column4: hi all, just a little advice; if i wanted to write a graphical application what graphic library would you suggest me?
well, it's obvious; but what is it better between GTK or QT or something else?
if dependencies don't matter then you might as well
so you think they are completely interchangeble?
as you asked, anything is an acceptable suggestion
you provided 2, so flip a coin if you can't think of any other reason you would pick between them

well, you should have looked at your other options before building it yourself; for example, the xorg-edgers ppa already builds it almost daily, and it installs it in the right place / works; so if you can clean up the mess, try the ppa
ok thanks, then i'll try to install it in the default directory
theres another ppa they run that just has stable driver updates in it as well
my purpose was to install ubuntu natty graphics driver(mesa too) to ubuntu 10.10
that's because i noticed that thoose drivers works better than theese
then you add the sources and use package pinning; but it is still somethingn you don't want to do, there were 2 xorg abi updates that natty rolled in iirc
unfortunately due to changes in natty the ppa stopped doing daily builds for maverick and older some time ago; otherwise you could just use it for updated drivers for mav as well
